Allow everyone to copy the entire document, or view it in full in fiddle mode.

Allow everyone to view Access Rules.

AccessRules.Remove column {{- colId }} from {{- tabl: Remove column {{- colId }} from {{- tableId }} rules
AccessRules.When adding table rules, automatically a: When adding table rules, automatically add a rule to grant OWNER full access.
AccessRules.This default should be changed if editor: This default should be changed if editors' access is to be limited.
AccessRules.Allow editors to edit structure (e.g. mo: Allow editors to edit structure (e.g. modify and delete tables, columns, layouts), and to write formulas, which give access to all data regardless of read restrictions.

AccountPage.Two-factor authentication is an extra la: Two-factor authentication is an extra layer of security for your Grist account designed to ensure that you're the only person who can access your account, even if someone knows your password.

DocPageModel.You can try reloading the document, or u: You can try reloading the document, or using recovery mode. Recovery mode opens the document to be fully accessible to owners, and inaccessible to others. It also disables formulas. [{{error}}]

WelcomeTour.Browse our {{templateLibrary}} to discov: Browse our {{templateLibrary}} to discover what's possible and get inspired.
WelcomeTour.Double-click or hit {{enter}} on a cell: Double-click or hit {{enter}} on a cell to edit it.
WelcomeTour.Make it relational! Use the {{ref}} type: Make it relational! Use the {{ref}} type to link tables.
WelcomeTour.Set formatting options, formulas, or col: Set formatting options, formulas, or column types, such as dates, choices, or attachments.
Start with {{equal}} to enter a formula.
WelcomeTour.Use the Share button ({{share}}) to shar: Use the Share button ({{share}}) to share the document or export data.
WelcomeTour.Use {{addNew}} to add widgets, pages, or: Use {{addNew}} to add widgets, pages, or import more data.
WelcomeTour.convert to card view, select data, and m: convert to card view, select data, and more.

GristTooltips.Apply conditional formatting to cells in: Apply conditional formatting to cells in this column when formula conditions are met.
GristTooltips.Apply conditional formatting to rows bas: Apply conditional formatting to rows based on formulas.
GristTooltips.Cells in a reference column always ident: Cells in a reference column always identify an {{entire}} record in that table, but you may select which column from that record to show.
GristTooltips.Click on “Open row styles” to apply cond: Click on “Open row styles” to apply conditional formatting to rows.
GristTooltips.Click the Add New button to create new d: Click the Add New button to create new documents or workspaces, or import data.
GristTooltips.Clicking {{EyeHideIcon}} in each cell hi: Clicking {{EyeHideIcon}} in each cell hides the field from this view without deleting it.
GristTooltips.Formulas that trigger in certain cases,: Formulas that trigger in certain cases, and store the calculated value as data.
GristTooltips.Link your new widget to an existing widg: Link your new widget to an existing widget on this page.
GristTooltips.Only those rows will appear which match: Only those rows will appear which match all of the filters.
GristTooltips.Pinned filters are displayed as buttons: Pinned filters are displayed as buttons above the widget.
GristTooltips.Rearrange the fields in your card by dra: Rearrange the fields in your card by dragging and resizing cells.
GristTooltips.Reference columns are the key to {{relat: Reference columns are the key to {{relational}} data in Grist.
GristTooltips.Select the table containing the data to: Select the table containing the data to show.
Select the table to link to.
GristTooltips.The Raw Data page lists all data tables: The Raw Data page lists all data tables in your document, including summary tables and tables not included in page layouts.
GristTooltips.The total size of all data in this docum: The total size of all data in this document, excluding attachments.
GristTooltips.They allow for one record to point (or r: They allow for one record to point (or refer) to another.
GristTooltips.This is the secret to Grist's dynamic an: This is the secret to Grist's dynamic and productive layouts.
GristTooltips.Try out changes in a copy, then decide w: Try out changes in a copy, then decide whether to replace the original with your edits.
GristTooltips.Unpin to hide the the button while keepi: Unpin to hide the button while keeping the filter.
GristTooltips.Use the \\u{1D6BA} icon to create summar: Use the \u{1D6BA} icon to create summary (or pivot) tables, for totals or subtotals.
GristTooltips.Useful for storing the timestamp or auth: Useful for storing the timestamp or author of a new record, data cleaning, and more.
You can filter by more than one column.
GristTooltips.Access rules give you the power to creat: Access rules give you the power to create nuanced rules to determine who can see or edit which parts of your document.
GristTooltips.Use the 𝚺 icon to create summary (or piv: Use the 𝚺 icon to create summary (or pivot) tables, for totals or subtotals.
GristTooltips.To make an anchor link that takes the us: To make an anchor link that takes the user to a specific cell, click on a row and press {{shortcut}}.
GristTooltips.You can choose one of our pre-made widge: You can choose one of our pre-made widgets or embed your own by providing its full URL.
GristTooltips.Can't find the right columns? Click 'Cha: Can't find the right columns? Click 'Change Widget' to select the table with events data.

To configure your calendar, select colum.end dates and event titles. Note each co: To configure your calendar, select columns for start/end dates and event titles. Note each column's type.

GristTooltips.A UUID is a randomly-generated string th: A UUID is a randomly-generated string that is useful for unique identifiers and link keys.
Lookups return data from related tables.
GristTooltips.Use reference columns to relate data in: Use reference columns to relate data in different tables.
GristTooltips.You can choose from widgets available to: You can choose from widgets available to you in the dropdown, or embed your own by providing its full URL.
GristTooltips.Formulas support many Excel functions, f: Formulas support many Excel functions, full Python syntax, and include a helpful AI Assistant.
GristTooltips.Build simple forms right in Grist and sh: Build simple forms right in Grist and share in a click with our new widget. {{learnMoreButton}}
GristTooltips.These rules are applied after all column: These rules are applied after all column rules have been processed, if applicable.

Need help? Our AI assistant can help.
FormulaAssistant.See our {{helpFunction}} and {{formulaCh: See our {{helpFunction}} and {{formulaCheat}}, or visit our {{community}} for more help.
Hi, I'm the Grist Formula AI Assistant.
FormulaAssistant.I can only help with formulas. I cannot: I can only help with formulas. I cannot build tables, columns, and views, or write access rules.
Press Enter to apply suggested formula.

UserManager.User has view access to {{resource}} res: User has view access to {{resource}} resulting from manually-set access to resources inside. If removed here, this user will lose access to resources inside.
